result.execSummary:
The defendant Shyla A. Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shyla A. Ward is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shyla A. Ward was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Shyla A. Ward was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: notice of entry of judgment returned
to Court from Jenaca Cebery

03:07 PM Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Defendant Shyla A. Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both counsel have received the Revocation Order and Warrant and are prepared to proceed today.  
Atty Hendee states sentencing recommendations. Atty Gumz states sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. 

BY THE COURT:
Ct 2:  Court sentences defendant to serve 90 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber for work and treatment.  Granted 129 days credit.

Ct 3:  Court sentences defendant to serve 9 months in the Marquette County Jail with huber for work and treatment.  Granted 129 days credit.  Sentence and sentence credit to run concurrent to Ct 2.

Court also orders the $667.80 still due is to be converted to a civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 18, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 24, 2019 at 10:00 am.
and Petition to Waive Appearance and Hearing

to Court from Shyla A Ward

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shyla A. Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is resolved.    State would move to amend Ct. 2 to remove the enhancer.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 2 & Ct. 3.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2 will be amended to remove the enhancer.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 2 and Ct. 3.  
Count 1 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz states that he did meet with Ms. Runge and Jim Webb about treatment court.  
Defendant states that her address was wrong and gives correct address.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 2 & Ct. 3:  Withhold Sentence; 18 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
bond to be applied
Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

of Warrant Cancellation
**Defendant was picked up on warrant; warrant quashed by the court.
Return date on February 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
*Same conditions as the previous bond

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shyla A. Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.  Atty Gumz states that the address will be her mother's address.  Mother gives address in court.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant was not living here anymore and does not have a license so she was unable to get here.  

Atty Hendee states that the parties have had discussions on the possibility of the Treatment Court Program.  Atty Hendee states that he believes that the defendant would be a good candidate for the program but she would have to have an evaluation done.

Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Court states that the defendant has posted $250 already and asks the State to clarify.  Atty Hendee requests an additional $500 cash.
Atty Gumz responds and asks $100-$200 cash bail.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets an additional $250 cash bond to be posted with the same bond conditions.  Return date scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shyla A. Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz will enter a Not Guilty plea.

Preliminary hearing at 03-16-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shyla A. Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF43 & 15CFR68 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that there is an agreement on 15CF43 but there is not an agreement on 15CF68 and that will have to be set for a Prelim.  

15CF43: Atty Hende moves to amend the charge to Misd. Failure to Report.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to that amended charge.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Atty Gumz has checked with Adams County Jail and Ms. Ward is on a Probation hold.  Defendant enters a No  Contest plea to the amended charge.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended charge.


BY THE COURT:  Amended Misd. Failure to Report:  Court orders 120 days in the Marquette County Jail; consecutive to any other sentence
Report Forthwith
May serve in Columbia County or Adams County
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in March

15CF68:  
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend the bond; No contact will be removed.  
Set for Prelim.

Atty Gumz asks that the committment be cancelled in 15FO74 and that the amount due be incorporated into the payment plan.  
BY THE COURT:  So ordered.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
